security: The document reveals cooperation between the FBI and foreign intelligence agencies (Austrian Federal Criminal Police, Swiss Central Police Bureau, covert CIA) in gathering information on Mark Lane. Disclosing these collaborative efforts could compromise relationships with these agencies and expose covert CIA operations. Directly quoting the memo: "Information in the enclosure was received by Legat Bern on Source in the memorandum or originator of communication is: Bundesministerium f√ºr Inneres, Abteilung 13...Schweizerisches Zentralpolizeibureau...Office of Special Assistant (covert CIA)."
summary: A memo from the FBI Legat in Bern to the Director, FBI, enclosing information from Austrian and Swiss police and covert CIA sources regarding Mark Lane.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret memorandum, dated January 5, 1965, is from the FBI Legat in Bern to the Director of the FBI, concerning Mark Lane. It encloses information received from the Austrian Federal Criminal Police, the Swiss Central Police Bureau, the Austrian Federal Security Police, the Swiss Federal Police, the Office of Special Assistant (covert CIA) in Bern, and the Research Branch (covert CIA) in Vienna. The memo directs the Bureau to check names in Bufiles and the Identification Division, and to furnish results of the investigation to the requesting agency, with copies sent to New York and Liaison.
title: MARK LANE, ADMIN
